In today's Early Look: "#Quad4 vs. Masa"  

Markets are doing #Quad4things. Yesterday‚Äôs Early Look was $NVDA vs. #Quad4‚Äîspecific fractal analysis.   

Today I'm zooming out to Big Vision Tech via Masa and the Buy-And-Bag-Hold process.

üí•J. Rickards and K. McCullough: Why Silver Could Hit $150 Sooner Than You Think

K. McCullough:  "In a frenzy, silver could go much higher than formulas suggest ... People chasing could take it to levels that seem impossible today"

The Gold Correlation Play
‚úÖ "There's no way gold goes to $10,000 without silver going to $100-150"
‚úÖ Silver historically amplifies gold's moves with 2-3x leverage
‚úÖ "Silver is along for gold's ride - but it's a rocket ship, not a passenger car"

The Ratio Play: 80:1 Can't Last
‚úÖ Current gold-silver ratio: 80:1 (historically unsustainable)
‚úÖ Historical average: 60:1 would mean $75 silver at $4,500 gold
‚úÖ Return to 30:1 ratio (ancient levels) would mean $150+ silver
‚úÖ "Only 8x more silver mined than gold, but 50% gets consumed industrially"

The $100-150 Price Target
‚úÖ "If gold hits $10,000, silver absolutely goes to $100-150"
‚úÖ Based on historical ratio analysis and supply-demand fundamentals
‚úÖ "Silver could actually be better money than gold for practical use"

Industrial Demand Multiplier
‚úÖ Unlike gold, silver has massive industrial consumption (50% of annual supply)
‚úÖ Solar, EVs, weapons, data centers creating structural deficit

While precise timing is unpredictable, the mathematical case for $100-150 silver is straightforward: either the gold-silver ratio normalizes to historical levels, or industrial demand creates a physical shortage that triggers a price explosion - and we're seeing both happen simultaneously.

HT: @Hedgeye @KeithMcCullough @JamesGRickards

Full cheat sheet:

üì∫ BIG TECH IS TIRED

Most big tech stocks ‚Äî especially $MSFT and $AAPL ‚Äî are weak or vulnerable.

This is a selective, tactical environment where chasing strength is risky and only the cleanest setups (like a potential $GOOGL rebuild or a guarded $TSLA bounce) are worth watching.

I also recently stepped back into $META for a tactical oversold bounce setup.

üì∫ DON‚ÄôT CHASE THE BOUNCE BEFORE $NVDA EARNINGS

Learn my trend analysis system: t3live.com/ma-ebook-tw-scott

$SPX / $SPY is bouncing off oversold levels, but it‚Äôs running straight into major resistance.

With #Nvidia earnings acting as a binary catalyst, this is a better area to trim risk than add it.

Until the report hits, any strength is just a bounce, not a breakout.

$SPX went from 6920 to 6574, about 4% off highs while many high-growth names fell 30‚Äì50%. We'll see if NVDA can help get the tape back on track for a Christmas Rally or not. $SPX is below the 8/21/50day ‚Äî tough to have conviction if you‚Äôre active.

¬πAn option is a contract that gives the holder the right, but not the obligation to buy or sell a specific asset at a predetermined price on or before a specified date. Options are a type of derivative, meaning their value is derived from the underlying asset.

¬≤A put option is a contract that gives the buyer the right, but not the obligation, to sell an underlying asset at a specified price (the strike price) by or on a specific date (the expiration date).

Investment in the fund is not an investment in the Underlying ETF. Distributions are not guaranteed. This product involves significant risks. Please go through the prospectus and risk information before investing. For important risk disclosures, please visit graniteshares.com/institutio‚Ä¶

If your portfolio relies on a single return driver, like global economic growth, it‚Äôs more fragile than you think.

Different conditions. Different opportunities. Different outcomes.

This is multi-dimensional diversification.

#DynamicWealthGroup

Most portfolios look diversified. Few are.

Stocks and bonds often move together because they share the same return drivers. 

When those shift, correlations rise, and the ‚Äúprotection‚Äù vanishes.

This is the diversification illusion.

#DynamicWealthGroup
